page.content: Also fourteen million gas fires.The demand for gas on the coldest winters day can be five times the amount on a summers day. {THE FIELD { }The story of the Morecambe gasfield began in the early 1970's when geologists first suggested that gas bearing rocks might exist beneath the sea off the South Cumbrian coast.The conditions were right,but the only way to test the theory was to embark on the costly business of drilling an exploration well.Taking into account all the supporting services,such an operation can cost in the region of Â£60,000 a day-or Â£42 a minute!British gas started to drill,or spudded in,its first exploration well in August,1974.
